goals.question: What is the trend of CO2 concentration over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of CO2 concentration over time
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is an increasing or decreasing trend in CO2 concentration over time.

goals.question: What is the average CO2 concentration by year?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average CO2 concentration by year
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there are any significant changes in the average CO2 concentration by year.

goals.question: What is the distribution of CO2 concentration?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the range and frequency of CO2 concentration values.

goals.question: What is the relationship between CO2 concentration and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of CO2 concentration and temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is any correlation between CO2 concentration and temperature.

goals.question: What is the seasonal pattern of CO2 concentration?
goals.visualization: Line chart of CO2 concentration by month
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is any seasonal pattern in CO2 concentration.

code:
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='co2_concentration', data=data)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    plt.title('What is the trend of CO2 concentration over time?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data['year'] = data['date'].dt.year
    yearly_avg = data.groupby('year')['co2_concentration'].mean().reset_index()
    
    sns.barplot(x='year', y='co2_concentration', data=yearly_avg)
    
    plt.title('What is the average CO2 concentration by year?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='co2-concentration', kde=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of CO2 concentration?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(x='CO2_concentration', y='Temperature', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between CO2 concentration and temperature?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='ignore')
    data['Month'] = data['Date'].dt.month
    
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.lineplot(x='Month', y='CO2_concentration', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the seasonal pattern of CO2 concentration?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
